SENT.plain: We present a rare complication of cisternal drain placement during aneurysm surgery
A ruptured anterior communicating artery aneurysm was clipped through a right pterional approach
A cisternal drain was inserted from the retro-carotid to the prepontine cistern
Postoperatively, a left-sided paresis of the upper extremity had developed
A CT brain scan revealed that the drain was located between the pons and the basilar artery, resulting in a pontine infarction
Vascular neurosurgeons should keep this complication in mind when placing a cisternal drain tube
The drain tube should not be inserted too deep into the prepontine cistern
